intro: Alstroemeria parviflora, commonly known as the mini lily or dwarf alstroemeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces showy blooms in shades of red, orange, yellow, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Alstroemeria parviflora is also valued for its long-lasting cut flowers and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
